#Text=Matrona of Chios
#Text=Saint Matrona of Chios , Greek icon
#Text=Saint Matrona of Chios ( also called " Saint Matrona Chiopolitis " ) was born during the 15th century in the village of Volissos on the island of Chios , Greece .

column1: #Text=This is the same village in which St. Markella was martyred in 1462 .
#Text=The Church celebrates her memory on October 20 , and the finding of her head on July 15 .
#Text=Life
#Text=Saint
#Text=Matrona was born in the village of Volissos on Chios sometime in the fourteenth century .
#Text=Her parents , Leon and Anna , were highly respected and well-to-do Christians .
#Text=Mary was the youngest of seven children .
#Text=From her youth , she showed an interest in monasticism .
#Text=When the time came for her parents to arrange her marriage , she refused because she wanted to remain a virgin .
#Text=To avoid this marriage , she left Volissos and went to an area overlooking the village , called Katavasis .
#Text=Here she began her spiritual struggle by fasting and prayer .
#Text=Soon other nuns joined her . [ 1 ]
#Text=Her parents searched everywhere to find her .
#Text=After locating her , they convinced her to return home .
#Text=Mary complied with her parents ' wishes , except for one â€” she refused to wed .
#Text=Her parents , seeing that she still desired to lead a monastic life , gave her their consent to pursue her ambition .
#Text=When Mary 's parents died , she distributed the farmland she inherited among her sisters and the orphans of the community .
#Text=She left Volissos and returned to Katavasis .
#Text=Her food was simple and brought to her by one of her sisters .
#Text=After three years she left Katavasis and went to the capital of the island , where there were many women 's monasteries . [ 2 ]
#Text=Upon visiting the different monasteries , Mary found a small secluded one consisting of three nuns : a mother and her two daughters .
#Text=The nuns , realizing her sincerity , immediately welcomed her into their home .
#Text=At this point Mary 's name was changed to St. Matrona .
#Text=( When a nun reaches a high point in her monastic life and becomes a Stavrophore , a new name is bestowed upon her , symbolizing a second baptism and a new way of life ) .
#Text=St. Matrona surpassed the other nuns in her devotion , spirituality , and understanding .
#Text=Her sincerity convinced other girls to come to this monastery and lead the same type of life .
#Text=The church itself was small , and so the abbess agreed with St. Matrona 's plan to enlarge it and to build cells for the nuns .
#Text=Any remaining farmland and personal belongings St. Matrona sold , and the monastery built a public bath with the money received from this sale so that the poor and wayfarers could bathe .
#Text=These baths were very common at this time .
#Text=After this , the renovation of the church began .
#Text=When the church was completed ( with the help of St. Artemios , to whom it was dedicated ) , the abbess of the monastery died .
#Text=The nuns then elected St. Matrona as the new abbess .
#Text=She showed charity to the poor , and was able to heal the sick . [ 1 ]
#Text=After the Genoese conquered the island of Chios , they plundered the island and the monasteries , including the monastery of St. Matrona .
#Text=When one of these foreigners attempted to attack the nuns of the monastery , the saint prayed for divine help .
#Text=From the heavens bolts of lightning fell to the ground , killing the assailant .
#Text=The foreigners , seeing the destruction , fled from the island in fear .
#Text=After these events , St. Matrona dreamt of her own death .
#Text=She suffered from an illness for seven days .
#Text=In the seven days she advised the other nuns as a mother would advise her children .
#Text=She received Holy Communion sometime before 1455 . [ 1 ]
#Text=She was buried in the monastery 's church , in which she had spent the greater part of her life .
#Text=To honor this great saint , Miracles are said to have occurred after her death .
#Text=Many people with all manner of afflictions came to the church and were cured .
#Text=In the village of Katavasis , there was a church built to honor the place where St. Matrona had first started her spiritual struggles .
#Text=Later , a larger church was built and the smaller one was used as a cemetery chapel .
#Text=Monastery of St. Matrona
#Text=The Holy Monastery of St. Matrona was built by the noble Roidis in 1470 near the village of Mesa Didima .
#Text=He originally intended to build a summer villa ; however , St. Matrona appeared to him in a dream and instructed him to build the monastery instead . [ 3 ]
#Text=His sisters were the first two nuns to enter the monastery .
#Text=The abbot of the monastery during the Turkish Occupation was the Holy Nikephoros of Chios .
#Text=Nikiforos wrote the 24 Hymns of Agia Matrona .
#Text=Today , four nuns dwell in the monastery .
#Text=The monastery celebrates the saint 's feast day on October 20 each year .
